executive_summary: Fashion designers in the United States have struggled throughout the current period. Designers in the industry faced several detrimental events, starting with COVID-19. The outbreak of the virus led to a nationwide shutdown of most businesses, which included fashion design studios and other retailers.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: COVID-19 Caused Significant Disruptions for Fashion Designers Across the United States
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: When the pandemic hit, state and local governments enforced lockdowns and stringent social distancing measures. Most in-person shopping establishments had to shut down in 2020 to conform to these measures. Since shoe stores, clothing retailers, jewelry establishments, textile designers and other relevant companies were shuttered, downstream demand for fashion designers plummeted.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: THE CORPORATE WORLD SHOWED SOME LIFE DURING THE PANDEMIC RECOVERY
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: As mass vaccination encouraged state and local governments to relax pandemic-era restrictions, stores opened up en masse again. Consumers used rising incomes to flock to retailers and other stores, spurring demand for clothing. To meet this increased demand for clothing, retailers and wholesalers sought out more fashion designers, which aided revenue growth.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: GROWING WORRY ABOUT THE STATE OF THE US ECONOMY HAS RECENTLY DAMPENED DEMAND
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Hot off a booming recovery, the US started to experience rapidly increasing inflation in 2022. Because of this, the Federal Reserve has been raising interest rates through contractionary monetary policy efforts. This has consequently brought worry to US markets and consumers alike, causing consumer confidence to plummet recently.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: CONSUMERS ARE EXPECTED TO BE IN A MUCH BETTER SPOT FINANCIALLY DURING THE OUTLOOK PERIOD
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The current period was plagued by several macroeconomic events (e.g., COVID-19, rising interest rates) that crushed consumer confidence and overall investment in fashion designers. As the US economy progresses through 2029, the fallout from COVID-19, spiking inflation and rising interest rates are all anticipated to dwindle.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: FAST-FASHION COLLABORATIONS WITH HIGH-END DESIGNERS WILL REACH MORE CONSUMERS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Recent collaborations between stores such as Target, H&M and Macy's and high-end luxury fashion designers have broadened the scope of the industry. Fashion designers are typically focused on higher-end premium items. However, the new collaborations have made luxury goods seem more affordable.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: A RETURN OF GLOBAL TRADE IS ANTICIPATED TO BENEFIT FASHION DESIGNERS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: While fashion designers don't have an exporting side of their business, a large portion of their business comes from retailers and wholesalers participating in exporting. The current period was marked by an appreciating US dollar, the pandemic and trade disruptions that lingered. This severely reduced exports for retailers and other downstream businesses, hindering revenue for the industry.

industry_definition: This industry comprises establishments that provide professional design services for products such as fashion, clothing, shoes, textiles, fur, jewelry, costumes, lighting and floats.
key_trends: Because of high fragmentation across the industry, there's very little concentration. Larger designers can hire more employees, but none are big enough to be considered major players.
External competition is moderate because fashion designers must contend with companies that provide their services in-house.
Another major substitute is artificial intelligence (AI).
The fallout of COVID-19 destroyed demand for fashion designers. Work-from-home measures meant that consumers had no need for any sort of clothing, let alone high-end fashion.
The anticipated return of global trade through 2029 is expected to benefit fashion designers. Major downstream markets, such as retailers and wholesalers, have a major exporting presence.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Retailers and wholesalers are the largest downstream market for fashion designers, holding over half of the revenue for the industry's services. Recently, large retailers have partnered with popular fashion designers to bring high-end designs to consumers at a lower, more accessible price.

Households and individuals sometimes use the industry's services to order individual designs on their clothing, causing consumers to comprise nearly one-fifth of revenue. During COVID-19, most of the nation had to remain socially distanced and work from home. As a result, households didn't seek many individual designs for their clothing because people weren't going to work, causing revenue for the consumer segment to drop.
Fashion houses are companies that design, manufacture and sell clothing, accessories and other fashion-related products. These houses sometimes rely on the industry to design their materials.

Apparel manufacturers consist of businesses that contract the industry to design mass-produced apparel. The largest threat to manufacturers in this industry is import penetration, and it has been on the rise through 2024. This is attributable to the dollar's rapid appreciation during the current period.
Government agencies and nonprofit organizations sometimes pay fashion designers to make uniforms for their employees.

products_and_services.product_description: Fashion designers directly design clothing for tailoring and patterns sent to manufacturers. Clothing design is the largest revenue segment for the industry, comprising nearly half of revenue.

Footwear design services include athletic, formal, casual and slipper designs. Because of the nature of the lockdown in 2020, consumers had to remain home and adhere to social distancing guidelines. As a result, they had a heightened amount of leisure time.
These segments feature the design of luxury and costume jewelry and accessories, including handbags, luggage, scarves and other nonclothing items.
Designers focus on various fabrics and material designs sent to manufacturers to produce clothing and other accessories. However, these services comprise the lowest percentage of revenue.
Other design services include anything from sports uniforms and costume design, among many other niche designs.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Per capita disposable income determines the amount of money consumers spend on clothing, footwear, jewelry, textiles and other materials designed by this industry. The discretionary nature of design services makes them dependent on consumers' ability to purchase goods outside their scope of necessity. Growth in per capita disposable income represents a potential opportunity for the industry.

business_locations.location_description: The Mid-Atlantic region is supported by New York's massive presence. Widely regarded as one of the fashion capitals of the world, New York City holds the largest concentration of designers in the United States. New York City also has a large consumer presence, giving fashion designers a huge downstream market.

The entertainment industry has bolstered establishments out West. The West region contains nearly three-tenths of all establishments, with California comprising nearly one-quarter of fashion designers, similar to New York. This is mostly the result of the presence of the industry's downstream markets in Los Angeles.

Miami is a bright spot in the Southeast. The Southeast mostly lacks the cultural centers that New York and California have, so fashion designers are far less prevalent in the Southeast. However, the region has been growing in popularity because of the emergence of Miami as a cultural center.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) is tasked with ensuring safe and healthy working conditions through the establishment of standards and by providing training, outreach, education and assistance programs.
Copyright is a type of intellectual property that protects original works of authorship as soon as an author fixes the work in a tangible form of expression.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Life Cycle Stage: mature, Revenue Volatility Level: high, Industry Assistance Level: low - steady, Competition Level: high - increasing
Capital Intensity Level: low, Concentration Level: low
There are very few legal obstacles for new entrants, as fashion designers often only need a basic business license to set up shop.

This labor-intensive industry requires at least a bachelor's degree to work at most companies. Many designers need a higher degree for better jobs. This raises the wages of fashion designers and makes labor a much higher barrier to entry than capital.

basis_points.basis_description: There's very little concentration. Larger designers can hire more employees, but none are big enough to be considered major players.
Fashion designers must contend with companies that provide their services in-house. Another major substitute is artificial intelligence (AI).

concentration_points.concentration_title: Fragmentation of designers limits market share concentration
concentration_points.concentration_description: Market share concentration is very low because of the prevalence of nonemployers. Sole proprietorships make up more than 90.0% of all establishments.

concentration_points.concentration_title: The pandemic recovery encouraged entry into the industry
concentration_points.concentration_description: Revenue soared immediately following COVID-19 as rising per capita disposable income encouraged consumers to spend more on clothing.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Labor-intensive nature of the industry keeps wages high
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Designing fashion requires technical skill, knowledge and physical labor to produce designs. As a result, the highly skilled nature of this industry causes wages to comprise more than one-third of revenue.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchase Costs are Associated with Higher Industry Activity
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchases for fashion designers include fabrics, sewing and cutting equipment, office supplies and other relevant materials. Higher-end fashion designers have higher average purchase costs.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: This labor-intensive industry requires at least a bachelor's degree to work at most companies. Many designers need a higher degree for better jobs.

volatility_points.volatility_title: COVID-19 ENHANCED VOLATILITY FOR FASHION DESIGNERS
volatility_points.volatility_description: With in-person shopping shutting down in 2020, fashion designers lost significant revenue.

volatility_points.volatility_title: THE RECENT STATE OF THE US ECONOMY CAUSED REVENUE TO FLUCTUATE
volatility_points.volatility_description: In 2022, the Federal Reserve started to raise interest rates to try and fight persistently high inflation.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Computer-aided design (CAD) is the use of computer technology to help in the creation, modification, analysis or optimization of a design.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: PUSHES IN SOCIAL MEDIA CAMPAIGNS DRIVE NEW DEMAND FOR THE INDUSTRY'S SERVICES
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Playing and adapting to emerging trends benefits fashion designers.

FAQs.question: How do economic changes influence consumer demand for your services?
FAQs.answer: As consumer spending and disposable income rise, demand for services increases as more consumers are willing to spend money on new clothes, accessories and footwear.

FAQs.question: Styles and trends change rapidly so what was popular last season may not be sellable the next season. How have shifting consumer preferences presented an opportunity/threat to your company's growth prospects?
FAQs.answer: Shifting consumer preferences towards fast fashion have given designers an opportunity to produce new items and explore other revenue channels to capitalize on this trend.

FAQs.question: The industry relies on the outsourcing of work by advertisers, manufacturers and other markets. Does your company face significant competition from substitute goods or services?
FAQs.answer: The industry's main competition is businesses that source design internally.

FAQs.question: What is your company's most significant operational expense?
FAQs.answer: Due to the labor-intensive nature of the industry and the fact that employees need to have a specific set of skills and knowledge, wages are the most significant expense for fashion designers.

FAQs.question: Has investment in new technologies, such as 3D printing and computer-aided design programs, increased your company's competitiveness?
FAQs.answer: Some designers have increasingly used customized design equipment and software packages to generate drafts and final products.

FAQs.question: Many companies are shifting their focus to implementing technology to reduce labor. Have you been able to reduce wage costs through automation over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: Due to the nature of the industry, fashion designers cannot reduce wage costs through automation.

FAQs.question: What are the toughest regulatory requirements that your company experiences?
FAQs.answer: The Fashion Designers industry is subject to rudimentary state-based business registrations.

FAQs.question: How does your company comply with regulatory requirements?
FAQs.answer: Fashion designers work with industry associations to stay up-to-date with the limited regulation applicable to the industry.

FAQs.question: Does your company struggle to finance its ongoing operations?
FAQs.answer: The inconsistency of design contracts can pose a cash flow problem for some businesses.

FAQs.question: Is your company looking to significantly expand its operations sometime in the near future?
FAQs.answer: The majority of companies are nonemployers and therefore due to the small-scale nature of the industry, fashion designers will most likely not expand operations in the future.

FAQs.question: Do you have a reputation for good quality service? How do you promote your products and services?
FAQs.answer: Designers that establish brand names in apparel, footwear and other fashion markets can leverage their brand names for further design recognition.

FAQs.question: What steps do you take to ensure your products are well presented and clearly displayed? How do you stay up to date with the latest trends?
FAQs.answer: Industry players need to present detailed and inspirational portfolios of designs.

FAQs.question: Have you adopted a commercial focus? Do you occasionally operate on a semi-professional basis?
FAQs.answer: Designers must remain focused on the commercial acceptance of their designs.

FAQs.question: What proportion of your demand comes from shoe manufacturing? Has the increased outsourcing of footwear manufacturing negatively affected you?
FAQs.answer: Footwear manufacturers' demand for design services affects industry revenue as this market accounts for significant portion of total industry revenue.

FAQs.question: How do you stimulate demand when disposable income levels are low? How will rising per capita disposable income benefit your company?
FAQs.answer: Per capita disposable income determines the amount of money that consumers have to spend on products designed by this industry.

FAQs.question: How much of your revenue is derived from clothing and clothing accessories stores? How do you plan to capitalize on this advantage?
FAQs.answer: Clothing and clothing accessories stores are the largest sources of revenue for the Fashion Designers industry.
